Using his chakra-made fishing rod, Urashiki launches a barrage of multiple hooks at his opponent to steal their chakra.

== Trivia ==
* The name of this technique is derived from an earlier version of the [[wikipedia:Urashima Taro|Urashima Taro]] folktale, in which a fisherman named Tsutsukawa no Shimako, or Ura no Shimako, is introduced to seven children named the Subaru-boshi, a reference to the [[wikipedia:Pleiades|Pleiades]] star cluster, at the entrance to the Palace of the Dragon King. "Subaru", normally written as {{translation|昴}}, meaning "cluster", is instead written as {{translation|須波流}}, meaning "essential wave current".
